definition: to respond to an emergency/to meet a contingency/(attributive) emergency
to worry/to feel anxious/Taiwan pr. [zhao1 ji2]
top priority job/matter of vital importance

sentences.english: Do not be hasty when climbing, sit for a while if you get tired.
sentences.chinese: 登山的時候不能急，累了就小坐片刻。

sentences.english: The downstream current was swift after the flood.
sentences.chinese: 洪水之後下游的水流很急。

sentences.english: If you are in a hurry, we have a two-hour quick service.
sentences.chinese: 如果您急着要，我們有兩小時的快速服務。

sentences.english: Eleanor jumps up and down, eager to show off her skills.
sentences.chinese: 埃莉諾跳上蹦下，急着要炫耀她的本領。

sentences.english: The emergency repair diskette was saved successfully.
sentences.chinese: 急修復磁盤已成功保存了。

sentences.english: He brought up the car at the curb.
sentences.chinese: 他在路緣把汽車急停下來。

sentences.english: Jim, come along. I'm in a hurry.
sentences.chinese: 噢，吉姆，快點，我急着要走呀。

sentences.english: Eager to get home, I took a shortcut through an alley.
sentences.chinese: 因爲急着想回家，我就抄近路走小巷子。

sentences.english: But his famous impatience is still close to thesurface.
sentences.chinese: 可是，他那著名的急脾氣，仍一覽無餘。

sentences.english: With the rapid business developed, we need staffers suitable for the following requirements.
sentences.chinese: 現因業務急需要招聘符合以下條件的職員。

sentences.english: Don't knock yourself up trying to finish the job.
sentences.chinese: 不要因爲急着完成這項工作把自己累病了。

sentences.english: You are not here. I am worried to death.
sentences.chinese: 你去哪裏了，真把我急得要死。

sentences.english: Don’t worry about traveling the entire world —be delighted with the world around you.
sentences.chinese: 不要急着環遊世界，去尋找你身邊的美好。

sentences.english: Relief of acute and chronic rhinitis symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 用於急，慢性鼻炎的症狀。

definition: to worry/to feel anxious/Taiwan pr. [zhao1 ji2]
to get panicky/to lose one's head/(coll.) (after 得) unbearably/terribly
to urge/to press/to prompt/to rush sb/to hasten sth/to expedite
to fret/to get impatient/to become anxious
lit. the fire burns one's eyebrows (idiom); fig. desperate situation/extreme emergency
slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate
